explicit

Class FastAdaptiveUniformisation.StateProp

  • java.lang.Object
    • explicit.FastAdaptiveUniformisation.StateProp
  • Enclosing class:
    FastAdaptiveUniformisation

    private static final class FastAdaptiveUniformisation.StateProp
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores properties of states needed for fast adaptive method. This includes the current-step probability, next-state probability, and the transient probability (sum of step probabilities weighted with birth process distributions). It also contains the list of successor states and the rates to them, the number of incoming transitions (references) and a flag whether the state has a significant probability mass (alive).

      • prepareNextIteration

        void prepareNextIteration()
        Prepares next iteration step. Sets current probability to next probability, and sets next probability to zero.

      • setSuccRates

        void setSuccRates(double[] succRates)
        Sets rates to successor states. Expects an array of rates, so that the rate to the successor state set by is the one given by the corresponding index. The value null is allowed here.
        Parameters:
        succRates - rates to successor states.

      • setSuccStates

        void setSuccStates(FastAdaptiveUniformisation.StateProp[] succStates)
        Sets successor states. Expects an array of successor states, so that the rate set by is the one given by the corresponding index. The value null is allowed here.
        Parameters:
        succStates - successor states

      • setAlive

        void setAlive(boolean alive)
        Sets whether state is alive.
        Parameters:
        alive - whether state should be set to being alive

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Checks whether state is alive.
        Returns:
        true iff state is alive

      • incReferences

        void incReferences()
        Increments the number of references of this state. The number of references should correspond to the number of alive states which have this state as successor state.

      • decReferences

        void decReferences()
        Decrements the number of references of this state. The number of references should correspond to the number of alive states which have this state as successor state.

      • delete

        void delete()
        Deletes this state. This means basically removing all of its successors. Beforehand, their reference counter is decreased, because this state does no longer count as a model state. It is left in the model however, because it might still be the successor state of some alive state.

      • canRemove

        boolean canRemove()
        Checks whether this state can be removed. This is only the case if its probability is below the threshold specified, and then only if there are no transitions from alive states into this state.
        Returns:
        true if and only if this state can be removed

      • hasSuccs

        boolean hasSuccs()
        Checks whether this state has successors or not. Will be true if and only if successor state array is nonnull.
        Returns:
        whether this state has successors or not

      • sumRates

        double sumRates()
        Returns the sum of all rates leaving to successor states.
        Returns:
        sum of all rates leaving to successor states
